Description: Painted pottery shabti of Šmʿyt n Imn Inh3y with a blue lappet-wig, a brown modelled face with black and white eyes, a blue and white collar that encloses the parallel brown hands in relief holding two red hoes; the front of the yellow leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs flanked by six similar rows; the back is decorated with a red and yellow representation of a seed-basket beneath a red yoke with two pendular nw-pots.
Condition: fair - paint worn, cracked at ankle level
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
